timelogger

Class WorkDay

  • java.lang.Object
    • timelogger.WorkDay

  • public class WorkDay
extends java.lang.Object
    With the instantiation of this class we can create work days. We can set the date of the work day, and the required minutes we should work today. We can check if the work day is weekday, and we can add tasks for the day. We can ask for the sum of the working minutes on this work day, and the extra minutes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WorkDay()
      This method is a constructor without any parameters.
      WorkDay(java.time.LocalDate actualDay)
      This method is a constructor with a LocalDate parameter.
      WorkDay(long requiredMinPerDay)
      This method is a constructor with a long parameter.
      WorkDay(long requiredMinPerDay, java.time.LocalDate actualDay)
      This method is a constructor with a long and a LocalDate parameter.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTask(Task task)
      This method adds a new task to the List named tasks, after it checks if the minutes of the task are the multiple of a quarter hour
      long getExtraMinPerDay()
      This method calculates the difference between the minutes while the employee worked and the minutes while the employee should have worked
      long getSumPerDay()
      This methods calculates the sum of the minutes of the tasks of this work day.
      boolean isWeekday()
      This method decides if this work day is a weekday or not

    • Constructor Detail

      • WorkDay

        public WorkDay(long requiredMinPerDay,
               java.time.LocalDate actualDay)
        This method is a constructor with a long and a LocalDate parameter.
        Parameters:
        requiredMinPerDay - In this parameter you can set the minutes you should work today.
        actualDay - In this parameter you can set the date, it will be the actual day.

      • WorkDay

        public WorkDay(long requiredMinPerDay)
        This method is a constructor with a long parameter. The default actual day will be today (server time).
        Parameters:
        requiredMinPerDay - In this parameter you can set the minutes you should work today.

      • WorkDay

        public WorkDay(java.time.LocalDate actualDay)
        This method is a constructor with a LocalDate parameter. The default required minutes will be 450 min=7.5 h
        Parameters:
        actualDay - In this parameter you can set the date, it will be the actual day.

      • WorkDay

        public WorkDay()
        This method is a constructor without any parameters. The default actual day will be today (server time). The default required minutes will be 450 min=7.5 h

    • Method Detail

      • getExtraMinPerDay

        public long getExtraMinPerDay()
        This method calculates the difference between the minutes while the employee worked and the minutes while the employee should have worked
        Returns:
        with the signed value of the extra minutes on this work day. If it is positive the employee worked more, if it is negative the employee worked less, then the required.

      • getSumPerDay

        public long getSumPerDay()
        This methods calculates the sum of the minutes of the tasks of this work day.
        Returns:
        with the minutes while the employee worked on this work day

      • addTask

        public void addTask(Task task)
        This method adds a new task to the List named tasks, after it checks if the minutes of the task are the multiple of a quarter hour
        Parameters:
        task - It is a Task type parameter, which will be added

      • isWeekday

        public boolean isWeekday()
        This method decides if this work day is a weekday or not
        Returns:
        true if it is a weekday, false if it is on weekend
